Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Elder Kent Chapman
Sister Cheryl Chapman

7821 E. Mendoza Ave Mesa, AZ 85209

Home: (480) 361-6466
Cell (Kent): (480) 862-9278

PhoenixAZ@byui.edu

Learn more about Phoenix Â»

Kent was born and raised in Magna, Utah. He attended Mount San Antonio College in California before serving in the Western Canadian Mission. Upon his return, he attended the University of Utah, until his active duty in the U.S. Army Reserve. After owning an Interstate Trucking company for 28 years, he retired and spent time with his son designing and manufacturing custom cabinets. He is currently the owner of GW Products, a tomato processing and distributing company. Kent has served in many church callings including Sunday School teacher, Activities Committee Chairman, Elders Quorum President, Stake and Ward Young Men's, and High Counselor. He has also been a volunteer seminary substitute teacher.

Cheryl was born in Nebraska, but grew up in the Salt Lake area. She attended Utah State University for 2 years. Soon after Kent returned from his mission, they were married in the Salt Lake Temple. They have lived in California, Utah, Texas, Idaho, and have currently lived in Mesa, Arizona for the past 30 years. They have 4 children and 13 wonderful grandchildren. While enjoying being a homemaker, Cheryl has given much service to the community through PTO, and Desert Club (a non-profit women's organization which provides funds to local charities and student scholarships). Before selling their inter-state trucking company, she helped with accounts receivables, freight claims, and customer service. She is presently employed with CES (S&I) as a support specialist at the Gilbert, AZ Seminary. She has been an ordinance worker in the Mesa, AZ Temple, and has served many years in the Young Women's in all capacities of stake and ward callings, 2 Relief Society presidencies and a teacher. She currently serves as a Ward Missionary in the Hawes Ward, Mesa, Az. Boulder Creek Stake.
